protocol.text: On the fifth day, approximately 7 mm of root tip was harvested for each seedling and pooled for each replicate.  The order of sample collection was randomized.  The root tips were flash frozen in liquid nitrogen then stored at -80° C until the time of RNA extraction.

Sterilized seeds of 170G-55-16, Cvi and Ler were placed on 1/2 LSPS + 1.5% agar E plates, stratified for 8 days at 4° C, and then placed in a 22° C growth chamber on a 16 h day/8 h night cycle.  Each replicate consisted of two rows of 60 seeds per row over five plates for a total of ~600 seedlings per replicate.  The plates were positioned vertically for 2 days, and then tilted back 30° for the final 3 days of growth.
RNA extraction of the ground root tissue was carried out with the RNAeasy kit (QIAGEN, Valencia, CA) according to manufacturer instructions.
Biotin-labeled cDNA was generated using the MessageAmp II kit (Ambion, Austin, TX) according to manufacturer instructions.

For each sample, the labeled cDNA was hybridized overnight on an ATH1 GeneChip (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA) in an AFX HybOven 480 (Affymetrix).  Post processing was done on an automated Fluidics 450 Station (Affymetrix).
Chips were scanned with the GC 3000 G7 scanner (Affymetrix).

Quality of microarray hybridization was determined using the Affymetrix MAS5 algorithm.  Expression differences were analyzed using ArrayStar 3 (DNAStar, Madison, WI).  The data were preprocessed using RMA and a quantile normalization method.  For statistical comparisons of expression levels, the student’s t-test option was employed with a FDR (Benjamini-Hochberg correction) multiple testing correction algorithm.
